ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

about.description:
"Iceberg is a high-performance format for huge analytic tables.
Iceberg brings the reliability and simplicity of SQL tables to big data, while making it possible for engines like 
Spark, Trino, Flink, Presto, Hive and Impala to safely work with the same tables, at the same time."
about.summary: Apache Iceberg is an open table format for huge analytic datasets

name: pyiceberg

about.description:
"Iceberg is a high-performance format for huge analytic tables.
Iceberg brings the reliability and simplicity of SQL tables to big data, while making it possible for engines like 
Spark, Trino, Flink, Presto, Hive and Impala to safely work with the same tables, at the same time."
about.summary: Apache Iceberg is an open table format for huge analytic datasets

about.description:
"Iceberg is a high-performance format for huge analytic tables.
Iceberg brings the reliability and simplicity of SQL tables to big data, while making it possible for engines like 
Spark, Trino, Flink, Presto, Hive and Impala to safely work with the same tables, at the same time."
about.summary: Apache Iceberg is an open table format for huge analytic datasets

raw_meta_yaml:
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/prefix-dev/recipe-format/main/schema.json
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: pyiceberg
  version: "0.11.0"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/${{ name[0] }}/${{ name }}/pyiceberg-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 095bbafc87d204cf8d3ffc1c434e07cf9a67a709192ac0b11dcb0f8251f7ad4e

build:
  number: 0
  script: ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  python:
    entry_points:
      - pyiceberg = pyiceberg.cli.console:run

requirements:
  build:
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - python
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
        - cython >=3.0.0
        - numpy
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ stdlib('c') }}
    - ${{ compiler('cxx') }}
  host:
    - python
    - poetry-core >=1.0.0
    - wheel
    - cython >=3.0.0
    - numpy
    - setuptools
    - pip
  run:
    - python
    - mmh3 >=4.0.0,<6.0.0
    - requests >=2.20.0,<3.0.0
    - click >=7.1.1,<9.0.0
    - rich >=10.11.0,<15.0.0
    - strictyaml >=1.7.0,<2.0.0
    - pydantic >=2.0,<3.0,!=2.4.0,!=2.4.1  # 2.4.0, 2.4.1 has a critical bug
    - sortedcontainers 2.4.0.*
    - fsspec >=2023.1.0
    - pyparsing >=3.1.0,<4.0.0
    - zstandard >=0.13.0,<1.0.0
    - tenacity >=8.2.3,<10.0.0
    - pyroaring >=1.0.0,<2.0.0
    - cachetools >=5.5.0,<7.0.0
  run_constraints:
    # https://github.com/apache/iceberg-python/blob/main/pyproject.toml#L60C1-L60C59
    - pyarrow >=17.0.0
    - pandas >=1.0.0,<3.0.0
    - python-duckdb >=0.5.0,<2.0.0
    - ray >=2.10.0,<3.0.0
    - python-snappy >=0.6.0,<1.0.0
    - thrift >=0.13.0,<1.0.0
    - mypy-boto3-glue >=1.28.18
    - boto3 >=1.24.59
    - s3fs >=2023.1.0
    - adlfs >=2023.1.0
    - gcsfs >=2023.1.0
    - psycopg2-binary >=2.9.6
    - sqlalchemy >=2.0.18,<3.0.0
    - getdaft >=0.2.12
    #- pyiceberg-core >=0.4.0,<0.5.0
    - polars >=1.21.0,<2.0.0
    #- thrift-sasl >=0.4.3
    #- kerberos >=1.3.1,<2.0.0

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - fb303
        - hive_metastore
        - pyiceberg
        - pyiceberg.avro.decoder_fast # Test compiled module
      pip_check: true
  - requirements:
      run:
        - pip
    script:
      - pyiceberg --help

about:
  summary: Apache Iceberg is an open table format for huge analytic datasets
  homepage: https://iceberg.apache.org/
  description: |
    "Iceberg is a high-performance format for huge analytic tables.
    Iceberg brings the reliability and simplicity of SQL tables to big data, while making it possible for engines like 
    Spark, Trino, Flink, Presto, Hive and Impala to safely work with the same tables, at the same time."
  repository: https://github.com/apache/iceberg
  documentation: https://iceberg.apache.org/docs/nightly/
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file:
    - LICENSE
    - NOTICE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - rxm7706

about.description:
"Iceberg is a high-performance format for huge analytic tables.
Iceberg brings the reliability and simplicity of SQL tables to big data, while making it possible for engines like 
Spark, Trino, Flink, Presto, Hive and Impala to safely work with the same tables, at the same time."
about.summary: Apache Iceberg is an open table format for huge analytic datasets
